<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/13/phase-one-trade-deal-needs-signatures?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’d Like to See the Trade Receipts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="dove handing over some wheat " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MjcyMDkxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. and China agreed to a partial trade deal. But we’re not popping the tariff-free bubbly until this thing is signed, sealed, delivered.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s none of those yet.</strong></span><span> Neither China nor the U.S. released the agreement text, which still needs to be translated, scrubbed, and signed.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The big picture </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This “<a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/12/13/china-stays-quiet-trade-agreement-despite-trumps-sign-off/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phase one</a>” deal has been 17 months in the making, but markets felt like your friend who didn’t see <em>La La Land </em>until 2018—a little disappointed after all the hype. Stocks <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/12/stocks-are-set-to-add-to-thursdays-rally-as-us-and-china-near-signing-of-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">barely moved</a> on the day. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What we know: </strong></span><span>A 25% tariff on $250 billion of Chinese imports will </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/f82cdc4c-1db7-11ea-9186-7348c2f183af?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stay put</a></span><span>. The 15% tariff placed on $120 billion of Chinese products in September will get cut in half to 7.5%. Tariffs scheduled for tomorrow are canceled.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What we don’t know: </strong></span><span>how much China plans on trimming its own tariffs and what kind of protections it’ll put on American intellectual property. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There was one important detail: agriculture spending</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china/u-s-china-trade-deal-swaps-tariff-rollbacks-for-farm-energy-purchases-idUSKBN1YH1SA?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">committed</a> to buying $32 billion of additional American agricultural goods over the next two years, helping out a group that’s been gut-punched by the trade war.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The new ag spending will boost China’s total U.S. farm-product purchases to $40 billion/year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Throughout the dispute, President Trump has </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/13/business/economy/china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promised</a></span><span> $50 billion/year in Chinese agricultural purchases. There’s no guarantee China will get there, but “they’ve already stepped it up,” Trump said Friday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">American farmers will have to claw back market share from Brazil, which has <a href="https://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3041285/beijing-redraws-its-agricultural-supply-lines-amid-trade-war-us?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepped in</a> as China’s premier soybean supplier. Brazil exported over 5 million tons of soybeans last month, 94% of which were headed for China. And for the first time ever, Brazil’s <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/8b2bb828-1ad0-11ea-97df-cc63de1d73f4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about to lap</a> the U.S. in soybean yield.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We’ll let a downbeat Goldman Sachs take the bottom line: </strong>“There is still some <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/13/goldman-is-disappointed-in-trade-deal-tariff-rollback-smaller-than-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uncertainty</a> regarding the status of this agreement, as it appears once again that some technical and legal details are still in flux.” If needed, we're ready for 17 more months of trade headlines. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/13/delivery-wars-ma-heats?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Need a Delivery Hero
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The food delivery world has consolidated so quickly, you wonder when it’ll stop taking orders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest deal?</strong> Berlin-based Delivery Hero <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/germanys-delivery-hero-heats-up-global-food-delivery-battle-with-4-billion-south-korea-deal-11576235909?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to buy</a> South Korea’s Woowa Brothers for $4 billion. Woowa Brothers, which operates under the brand Baedal Minjok, is the country’s largest online food delivery service. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With more of the population single, living alone, and glued to smartphones, South Korea is the </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-woowa-brothers-delivery-hero/delivery-hero-orders-up-south-koreas-woowa-for-4-billion-in-worlds-biggest-food-app-deal-idUSKBN1YH08S?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fourth-largest market</a></span><span> for online food orders.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More demand means more competition. The deal was a “survival strategy,” a Woowa spokesman said. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The wide world of food delivery</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Food delivery battles like the one in South Korea are happening <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2019-12-13/what-s-good-for-delivery-hero-investors-isn-t-so-good-for-clients?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all over the globe</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Europe: </strong></span><span>Takeaway.com and the tech investment firm Prosus are sparring to buy the British service Just Eat. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The U.S.: </strong></span><span>DoorDash bought Square’s Caviar this summer for more ammo in its fight with Grubhub. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Asia: </strong></span><span>Rival companies are tapping giants like Alibaba, SoftBank, and Tencent for capital.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>In 2009, the restaurant tech vertical received just over $75 million in venture funding, <a href="https://pitchbook.com/news/articles/delivery-startups-and-other-unicorns-are-transforming-restaurant-tech?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">according to PitchBook</a>. Last year, total funding in the sector topped $8 billion.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The holidays are supposed to be <em>relaxing</em>. For many of us, they’re anything but. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which is unpleasant, unhealthy, and completely uncool. So don’t let it happen to you.</p>

Just enter BREW15 at checkout. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So put yourself at the top of your own holiday gift list, and let <a href="http://welcome.greenroadsworld.com/MorningBrewA" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Green Roads</a> help you stress less this season.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LABOR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/13/dems-say-wont-cross-picket-line-debate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Strike and They’re All Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Elizabeth Warren " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjE4L2VsaXphYmV0aF93YXJyZW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lorie Shaull from St Paul, United States, Senator Elizabeth Warren speaking at the Heartland Forum in Storm Lake, Iowa (33633612638), CC BY-SA 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The biggest controversy around Thursday’s Democratic presidential debate used to be that 6/7 of the <a href="https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/seven-candidates-have-qualified-for-the-december-democratic-debate/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">qualified candidates</a> are white. Now, 7/7 might not show up.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The debate is supposed to take place at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles, but members of a union representing subcontracted food service workers are <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/12/13/787870834/top-2020-candidates-threaten-to-skip-upcoming-democratic-debate-amid-labor-dispu?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">picketing</a> the school (and debate) for higher wages and healthcare benefits. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The event was already moved from its original location, UCLA, over another </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2019-11-08/democratic-primary-debate-moves-from-ucla-to-loyola-marymount-university?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">labor dispute</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Domino theory </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Sen. Elizabeth Warren <a href="https://twitter.com/ewarren/status/1205542327470698497?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted</a> she won’t cross the picket line unless the DNC finds a solution supporting the union. Within three hours, all other qualified candidates followed her lead. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The candidates are all trying to win the labor union vote—a core part of the Democratic constituency that’s been <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Technology/wireStory/big-tech-big-labor-2020-democrats-line-unions-65324482?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrinking</a> in recent years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Several candidates dropped in on </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/us/politics/elizabeth-warren-uaw-strike.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UAW’s GM strike</a></span><span> this year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Warren and former VP Joe Biden even announced their candidacies at sites with union ties. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we’re refreshing the DNC's Twitter to see if they’ll pull the debate. If it gets scrapped, there’ll be just one more debate (on Jan. 14) before the Iowa caucuses.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/13/bank-america-downgrades-hanesbrands?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Heavy Is the Hanes That Wears the Crown
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Did you know:</strong> The same company that makes your tighty-whities also makes the Champion sweatshirts you overpay for at Urban Outfitters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And Champion is <em>this </em>close to catching up in terms of “cool” factor.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With nearly 6 million Instagram followers, evangelists like Chance the Rapper (who made it “unlame”), and double-digit growth last holiday season, century-old Champion has capitalized on the $100 billion market for vintage-inspired, logo-obsessed, teen-adored streetwear <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-04-16/champion-sports-shoes-hoodies-and-brand-make-unlikely-comeback?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to keep</a> its demographic-agnostic parent Hanesbrands relevant.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But...Bank of America on Friday <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/underwear-maker-hanesbrands-falls-on-worries-about-champion-brand-11576265059?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">downgraded</a> its Hanesbrands rating in anticipation of Champion sales slowing. “Its distribution is relatively saturated in the U.S. and we worry that changing fashion trends could rein in brand momentum,” BofA said.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Brewgle translate: </strong></span><span>Champion has run out of budding hype beasts to target.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big picture:</strong> Hanesbrands has seen 10 straight years of revenue growth, partially due to Champion’s surge in popularity. But a 5.1% share price drop after Friday’s downgrade illustrates how risky it can be to put most of your eggs in one basket...especially if investors aren’t big on that basket.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today we’re bringing you another all-star lineup of the weird, the wacky, and the wistful from this week’s news. Three of the following news headlines are real, but one is made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“School bus </span><span><a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/jgeegb/school-bus-evacuated-due-to-overwhelming-smell-of-axe-body-spray?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">evacuated</a></span><span> due to overwhelming smell of Axe body spray” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“School of Rock: The </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/9DVn6JlIh2Bhe/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">art of crowd surfing</a></span><span> gets its own class at Oberlin”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Pigeons in tiny cowboy hats </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/us/pigeons-cowboy-hats-las-vegas-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are a mystery</a></span><span> in Las Vegas”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“‘My boss lets us book </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-50731781?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hangover days</a></span><span>’”</span>
</li>
</ol>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MjcyMDkxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. and China agreed to a partial trade deal. But we’re not popping the tariff-free bubbly until this thing is signed, sealed, delivered.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s none of those yet.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Neither China nor the U.S. released the agreement text, which still needs to be translated, scrubbed, and signed.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe big picture \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis “\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/12/13/china-stays-quiet-trade-agreement-despite-trumps-sign-off/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephase one\u003c/a\u003e” deal has been 17 months in the making, but markets felt like your friend who didn’t see \u003cem\u003eLa La Land \u003c/em\u003euntil 2018—a little disappointed after all the hype. Stocks \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/12/stocks-are-set-to-add-to-thursdays-rally-as-us-and-china-near-signing-of-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebarely moved\u003c/a\u003e on the day. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat we know: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA 25% tariff on $250 billion of Chinese imports will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/f82cdc4c-1db7-11ea-9186-7348c2f183af?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estay put\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. The 15% tariff placed on $120 billion of Chinese products in September will get cut in half to 7.5%. Tariffs scheduled for tomorrow are canceled.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat we don’t know: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ehow much China plans on trimming its own tariffs and what kind of protections it’ll put on American intellectual property. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere was one important detail: agriculture spending\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trade-china/u-s-china-trade-deal-swaps-tariff-rollbacks-for-farm-energy-purchases-idUSKBN1YH1SA?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecommitted\u003c/a\u003e to buying $32 billion of additional American agricultural goods over the next two years, helping out a group that’s been gut-punched by the trade war.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe new ag spending will boost China’s total U.S. farm-product purchases to $40 billion/year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThroughout the dispute, President Trump has \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/13/business/economy/china-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epromised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e $50 billion/year in Chinese agricultural purchases. There’s no guarantee China will get there, but “they’ve already stepped it up,” Trump said Friday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmerican farmers will have to claw back market share from Brazil, which has \u003ca href=\"https://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3041285/beijing-redraws-its-agricultural-supply-lines-amid-trade-war-us?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estepped in\u003c/a\u003e as China’s premier soybean supplier. Brazil exported over 5 million tons of soybeans last month, 94% of which were headed for China. And for the first time ever, Brazil’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/8b2bb828-1ad0-11ea-97df-cc63de1d73f4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout to lap\u003c/a\u003e the U.S. in soybean yield.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe’ll let a downbeat Goldman Sachs take the bottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“There is still some \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/13/goldman-is-disappointed-in-trade-deal-tariff-rollback-smaller-than-expected.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euncertainty\u003c/a\u003e regarding the status of this agreement, as it appears once again that some technical and legal details are still in flux.” If needed, we're ready for 17 more months of trade headlines. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest deal?\u003c/strong\u003e Berlin-based Delivery Hero \u003ca Woowa Brothers, which operates under the brand Baedal Minjok, is the country’s largest online food delivery service. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith more of the population single, living alone, and glued to smartphones, South Korea is the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-woowa-brothers-delivery-hero/delivery-hero-orders-up-south-koreas-woowa-for-4-billion-in-worlds-biggest-food-app-deal-idUSKBN1YH08S?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efourth-largest market\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for online food orders.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore demand means more competition. The deal was a “survival strategy,” a Woowa spokesman said. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, Out\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Elizabeth Warren \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eLorie Shaull from St Paul, United States, Senator Elizabeth Warren speaking at the Heartland Forum in Storm Lake, Iowa (33633612638), CC BY-SA 2.0\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe biggest controversy around Thursday’s Democratic presidential debate used to be that 6/7 of the \u003ca href=\"https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/seven-candidates-have-qualified-for-the-december-democratic-debate/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equalified candidates\u003c/a\u003e are white. Now, 7/7 might not show up.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe debate is supposed to take place at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles, but members of a union representing subcontracted food service workers are \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/12/13/787870834/top-2020-candidates-threaten-to-skip-upcoming-democratic-debate-amid-labor-dispu?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epicketing\u003c/a\u003e the school (and debate) for higher wages and healthcare benefits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe event was already moved from its original location, UCLA, over another \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2019-11-08/democratic-primary-debate-moves-from-ucla-to-loyola-marymount-university?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elabor dispute\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDomino theory \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Sen. Elizabeth Warren \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ewarren/status/1205542327470698497?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted\u003c/a\u003e she won’t cross the picket line unless the DNC finds a solution supporting the union. Within three hours, all other qualified candidates followed her lead. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe candidates are all trying to win the labor union vote—a core part of the Democratic constituency that’s been \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Technology/wireStory/big-tech-big-labor-2020-democrats-line-unions-65324482?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrinking\u003c/a\u003e in recent years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSeveral candidates dropped in on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/22/us/politics/elizabeth-warren-uaw-strike.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eUAW’s GM strike\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWarren and former VP Joe Biden even announced their candidacies at sites with union ties. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’re refreshing the DNC's Twitter to see if they’ll pull the debate. If it gets scrapped, there’ll be just one more debate (on Jan. 14) before the Iowa caucuses.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDid you know:\u003c/strong\u003e The same company that makes your tighty-whities also makes the Champion sweatshirts you overpay for at Urban Outfitters.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd Champion is \u003cem\u003ethis \u003c/em\u003eclose to catching up in terms of “cool” factor.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith nearly 6 million Instagram followers, evangelists like Chance the Rapper (who made it “unlame”), and double-digit growth last holiday season, century-old Champion has capitalized on the $100 billion market for vintage-inspired, logo-obsessed, teen-adored streetwear \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2019-04-16/champion-sports-shoes-hoodies-and-brand-make-unlikely-comeback?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto keep\u003c/a\u003e its demographic-agnostic parent Hanesbrands relevant.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut...Bank of America on Friday \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/underwear-maker-hanesbrands-falls-on-worries-about-champion-brand-11576265059?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edowngraded\u003c/a\u003e its Hanesbrands rating in anticipation of Champion sales slowing. “Its distribution is relatively saturated in the U.S. and we worry that changing fashion trends could rein in brand momentum,” BofA said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrewgle translate: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChampion has run out of budding hype beasts to target.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Hanesbrands has seen 10 straight years of revenue growth, partially due to Champion’s surge in popularity. But a 5.1% share price drop after Friday’s downgrade illustrates how risky it can be to put most of your eggs in one basket...especially if investors aren’t big on that
